Key Match Events: Egypt lost Mohamed Salah to injury but twice fought back from behind to draw 2-2 with Ghana at the Africa Cup of Nations.
Mohamed Kudus scored a stunning opener for Ghana just 53 seconds after Salah left the field with an apparent hamstring issue.
Omar Marmoush restored parity for Egypt in the 69th minute after a dreadful pass from Inaki Williams.
Mohamed Kudus doubled his tally 101 seconds later to put Ghana back in the lead.
Mostafa Mohamed scored from Trezeguet’s cutback to level the score for Egypt once more.
Iddrisu Baba missed a crucial chance in stoppage time, heading wide of a gaping goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Egypt boss Vitoria gave an update after Salah was forced off during the draw with Ghana.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw three goals scored in the space of five minutes and 10 seconds during the second half.
Ghana's Abdul Samed was taken off on a stretcher but later returned to the pitch.
